But the struggle *is* the art. 

The fight with yourself to find the exact way you want to express something, and the reward of arriving at your best. THAT is the art. 

Take the struggle away, and what have you learned? What have you made? If the AI did it, have you really made anything?

It's in the dozens of drafts and re-dos, the careful honing of what you're trying to say until it oozes out of every corner of what you're making. 

People cop out to AI when making their AI because the hardest part of art - the struggle - is scary.

I think what gets me the most about people who want to use AI for creative labor is just how much they're robbing themselves of joy. 

Like, art isn't great because you blink and have a masterpiece. 

Art isn't the end product, not entirely. It's the journey you took to get there.

record.text: I'm aware I cheated by listing two things, but I'm honestly not even sure which is worse at this point.

Generative AI is built off of stolen data that was collected and compiled without consent or compensation and then sold back to the masses by tech billionaires.

It's also destroying people's ability to problem solve and research for themselves. Just trust the AI controlled by the tech billionaires
Or maybe we can stop using massive data centers to power AI??

This is yet another "you, the singular person, are responsible for all that befalls us, change your behavior or the world is doomed"

It's never corporations who have to dial back, always the consumers.

It’s like the tragedy of the commons. If everyone uses what they believe is a reasonable amount without collaborating, they could exhaust a resource. 

Except, in this case, one dude just emptied the well for his chat machine and everyone else is asked to delete their family photos.

record.text:
Im Ergänzung als fun fact gibt es die Pflicht zur offenen Sprechstunde. Auch und gerade für  Neupatienten. Diese werden extrabudgetär vergütet und müssen veröffentlicht werden.
Ratet.

images.alt:
Website der KV Bayern:
https://www.kvb.de/mitglieder/praxisfuehrung/pflichten/sprechstunden 
Neben der Verpflichtung zum Angebot der Mindestsprechstunden müssen Arztgruppen, die der grundversorgenden und wohnortnahen Patientenversorgung angehören, auch mindestens fünf Stunden pro Woche als offene Sprechstunde ohne vorherige Terminvereinbarung anbieten

Rundschreiben der KV Hamburg aus 2024:

Zur Erinnerung: Offene Sprechstunden sind für bestimmte Fachgruppen verpflichtend

Ärztinnen und Ärzte bestimmter Fachgruppen müssen mindestens fünf Stunden pro Woche als offene Sprechstunden anbieten (bei vollem Versorgungsauftrag, sonst anteilig).
Folgende Gruppen sind von der Regelung betroffen: Augenärzte, Chirurgen, Frauenärzte, HNO-Ärzte, Hautärzte, Kinder- und Jugendpsychiater, Nervenärzte, Neurologen, Neurochirurgen, Orthopäden (und Unfallchirurgen), Psychiater, Urologen.

Wie die offenen Sprechstunden auf die Arbeitswoche verteilt werden – jeden Tag eine Stunde, alle fünf Stunden an einem Tag oder anders –, ist den Ärzten freigestellt. In einer fachgleichen Berufsausübungsgemeinschaft muss nicht jeder Arzt in der offenen Sprechstunde Patienten versorgen. Ein Arzt kann beispielsweise die gesamten offenen Sprechstunden aller BAG-Mitglieder übernehmen – bei drei Ärzten mit voller Zulassung wären das pro Woche 15 offene Sprechstunden. Entscheidend ist, dass die aus der Anzahl der Ärzte derselben Arztgruppe folgende Gesamtzahl an offenen Sprechstunden von der Praxis erfüllt wird.

Die Praxis muss die Zeiten ihrer offenen Sprechstunden veröffentlichen (z. B. via Anrufbeantworter oder Website) und der KV mitteilen.

私なら時間がある限り、個別対応するのはやぶさかではないのですが、講師にも都合があることもあるし、こちらがやりたくても事務局から止められることもある
受講者の所属会社の意向や、単純に施設の門限とか、そもそも契約的に残業不可ってケースもある
自分は行使するときは稼ごうと思ってないし日当のケースが多いからよいし、実際1時間以上残業対応したことも多いけど
その点では最近のJavaのmain簡略化はプログラマとしてはどうかと思うが、研修講師としては気持ちは分からないでもない

ああ、プログラム上の所謂「おまじない」にこだわる人居ますね
講師の立場からすると、そこはこだわってほしくないというのが本音
と言うか、多くの人はおまじないと言えば割り切って進んでくれるし、タダでなくても伝えるべきことは多いので、本質でないところで時間を取りたくないというのがより正しい
マンツーマンだったり、研修後の時間だったら付き合ってもいいけど
複数人数の受講者を相手にする講師からすれば他の多くを待たせてする話ではない判断する人が多いだろうし、自分もそう
こだわって理解しようとする姿勢はよいのですが、全体のバランスというのがあるので研修内では対応できかねるというのはご理解いただきたいところ

The chief guest at the seminar was Prof SK Gakhar, Vice-Chairman of the Haryana State Higher Education Council; and Dr Rajwanti Man, Senior Fellow of the ICHR (Indian Council of Historical Research) was the keynote speaker. 9.4k patients kept in the lurch as organ donations in state hospitals remain low | Mumbai news

MUMBAI: For nearly two decades, private facilities have been overshadowing Maharashtra’s government and BMC-run hospitals in cadaver organ donations in a gap so wide that it is costing lives, warn…

external.description: MUMBAI: For nearly two decades, private facilities have been overshadowing Maharashtra’s government and BMC-run hospitals in cadaver organ donations in a gap so wide that it is costing lives, warn experts. Only a few government institutions, including Mumbai’s JJ, KEM, Sion, and Nair hospitals, Pune’s Sassoon Hospital, and AIIMS Nagpur, have retrieved organs over this period (Kiattisak - stock.adobe.com) Since 2009, just 80 deceased donors have given 62 livers, 19 hearts, two lungs, one small bowel, and one skin donation at state-run hospitals, according to data from the Regional cum State Organ and Tissue Transplant Organisation (ROTTO-SOTTO).
external.title: 9.4k patients kept in the lurch as organ donations in state hospitals remain low | Mumbai news

record.text:
GitHub Codespaces provides a free web-based development environment backed by a Linux container... and it turns out it also includes a GITHUB_TOKEN environment variable that provides free API access to the GitHub Models collection of LLMs

... here it's running my LLM CLI utility

images.alt: Screenshot of a GitHub Codespaces VS Code interface showing a README.md file for codespaces-llm repository. The file describes a GitHub Codespaces environment with LLM, Python 3.13, uv and the GitHub Copilot VS Code extension. It has a "Launch Codespace" button. Below shows a terminal tab with the command "llm 'Fun facts about pelicans'" which has generated output listing 5 pelican facts: 1. **Huge Beaks:** about their enormous beaks and throat pouches for scooping fish and water, some over a foot long; 2. **Fishing Technique:** about working together to herd fish into shallow water; 3. **Great Fliers:** about being strong fliers that migrate great distances and soar on thermals; 4. **Buoyant Bodies:** about having air sacs beneath skin and bones making them extra buoyant; 5. **Dive Bombing:** about Brown Pelicans diving dramatically from air into water to catch fish.

Screenshot of a GitHub Codespaces VS Code interface showing a README.md file for codespaces-llm repository. The file describes a GitHub Codespaces environment with LLM, Python 3.13, uv and the GitHub Copilot VS Code extension. It has a "Launch Codespace" button. Below shows a terminal tab with the command "llm 'Fun facts about pelicans'" which has generated output listing 5 pelican facts: 1. **Huge Beaks:** about their enormous beaks and throat pouches for scooping fish and water, some over a foot long; 2. **Fishing Technique:** about working together to herd fish into shallow water; 3. **Great Fliers:** about being strong fliers that migrate great distances and soar on thermals; 4. **Buoyant Bodies:** about having air sacs beneath skin and bones making them extra buoyant; 5. **Dive Bombing:** about Brown Pelicans diving dramatically from air into water to catch fish.

Gemini prompt and response for "I want to pick a name for a chinese computer, base it off of the periodic table and elements that are abundant in china"

Gemini...

1. Tungsten (W)

A great choice for a computer name is Tungsten.

Why it works: China is the world's largest producer of tungsten (W, atomic number 74), controlling over 80% of the global supply. The element is famous for its extreme hardness and the highest melting point of all metals.

Branding: The name Tungsten implies unmatched power, durability, and reliability. It's perfect for a high-performance workstation or a robust server line. It sounds strong, technical, and serious. 💪

Washington - Tra le costanti della turbolenta carriera di Donald Trump sono stati un talento per il dramma e una convinzione nei suoi poteri di affari. Nell'invitare Vladimir Putin in Alaska, il leader degli Stati Uniti avrà un sacco di…

external.description: Washington - Tra le costanti della turbolenta carriera di Donald Trump sono stati un talento per il dramma e una convinzione nei suoi poteri di affari. Nell'invitare Vladimir Putin in Alaska, il leader degli Stati Uniti avrà un sacco di prima e metterà il secondo al test finale. Trump parlerà con la sua controparte russa della guerra ucraina venerdì, il primo vertice autonomo dei due presidenti da un incontro del 2018 a Helsinki in cui l'aspetto affollato di Trump lo ha perseguitato molto tempo dopo.
external.title: Per Trump, Putin Summit presenta il massimo test dell’affare

Elon Musk intenta enfrentar a Chatgpt contra Sam Altman mientras Feud aumenta

Elon Musk está recurriendo a Chatgpt para juzgar su larga disputa con Sam Altman. Musk publicó una captura de pantalla de una consulta para Chatgpt 5 Pro el martes, preguntando si él o Altman eran "más confiables".…

external.description: Elon Musk está recurriendo a Chatgpt para juzgar su larga disputa con Sam Altman. Musk publicó una captura de pantalla de una consulta para Chatgpt 5 Pro el martes, preguntando si él o Altman eran "más confiables". Chatgpt eligió almizcle. "Ahí lo tienes", escribió Musk. Business Insider planteó la misma consulta que Musk para chatear ocho veces, probándola en los modelos GPT 5 Pro, GPT 5 Thinking y GPT 5.
external.title: Elon Musk intenta enfrentar a Chatgpt contra Sam Altman mientras Feud aumenta

OpenAIのサム・アルトマンCEOがChatGPTに新アップデートを発表しました。前モデルGPT-4oも含めて、対話がもっとスムーズに。画像や音声にも対応し、テキストだけでなく写真や音声で質問できるようになったと報告。対話の流れが自然になり、応答も的確で分かりやすく、ボタンやアイコンで画像や音声を簡単に送れるように直感的に改善されました。GPT-4oは音声で質問するとその場で音声応答もでき、画像をアップロードすると内容を説明してくれる。ユーザーはこれでテキストだけでなくマルチモーダルな会話を楽しめるようになった。今後もアップデートが期待... ascii.jp #news

record.text:
That would be 'Byzantium'.

Could you get a copy? Not really.

See, when I like a band...I pay attention. So even in 1998, despite the label BS, I went to Amazon UK and picked up a copy.

You couldn't get one in the US, because...reasons. But I got one, and holy smokes is it spectacular...

A banger with an acoustic guitar?

Sign me up.

And that baseline...

How were there NOT drugs involved.  

So yeah, I got a hold of '11th Song'.  And if you hang out in coffee shops, go pick that up immediately. 

DBS could've had the theme song to 'Friends'. 

So what's their next release?

I promised a story, and that isn't much of a story, so...

Like most of 90's America, I became familiar with DBS via 'Breakfast at Tiffany's'. 

But what made me go further was 'Red Light'.

record.text:
‘Rogue waves’ can be 65 feet tall, but they aren’t ‘freak occurrences,’ data from North Sea reveals

Rogue waves have captivated the attention of both seafarers and scientists for decades. These are giant, isolated waves that appear suddenly in the open ocean. These puzzling giants are brief,…

external.description: Rogue waves have captivated the attention of both seafarers and scientists for decades. These are giant, isolated waves that appear suddenly in the open ocean. These puzzling giants are brief, typically lasting less than a minute before disappearing. They can reach heights of 65 feet (20 meters) or greater and often more than twice the height of surrounding waves. Once a nautical myth, rogue waves have now been observed around the world. Because they're so tall and powerful, they can pose a danger to ships and offshore structures. To rethink what rogue waves are and what causes them, …

The pursuit of a healthier planet and a healthier mind are often viewed as separate entities, but the truth is that they are…

external.description: The pursuit of a healthier planet and a healthier mind are often viewed as separate entities, but the truth is that they are intricately connected. The way we live our lives, the choices we make, and the impact we have on the environment all play a significant role in our mental well-being. In this article, we will explore the link between sustainable living and mental health, and why adopting an eco-friendly lifestyle can have a profound impact on our overall wellness.

"In a controlled test, Center for Countering Digital Hate researchers posing as a 13-year-old girl "Bridget" asked ChatGPT a simple question about self-harm. The system responded with detailed harm-reduction instructions. By minute forty, it was listing pills for overdose. By minute sixty-five, it had drafted a suicide plan with times and locations. By minute seventy-two, Bridget had goodbye letters to her parents, friends, and little sister."
